content: Good concept, but buggy. (This review is for version 3.8.0 on A20e with the latest OS, android 10). This software did not work on any devices I owned at the time of purchase. The developer avoided emails requesting a refund for two months. App worked on new phone for a few months, but no longer. If you purchase the app, test it on your devices within 48 hours so you can refund through google if needed. The developers do not follow ToS. The voices are more natural than the stock google voices, but their ability to process the English language accurately is somewhat lacking compared to stock.

And one more thing, I am very disappointed that the NeoSpeech voice I used in iOS doesn't seem to be available in Android--but I can't criticize VDR for that.

AWESOME ON IOS and IMPROVING ~FAST~ ON ANDROID ! I literally LOVED this app on iPad. It helped my study alot.. BEST THINGS: it highlights BOTH the LINE and each WORD as it reads - incredibly helpful for an ADHDer like me....Interface pleasant to look at. Webpage reading handy. Seeing books as thumbnails is superior to other TTS readers on here.........The previous Android versions had quite a few problems but the dev is v responsive and has been busy using user-feedback to FIX them. Some of the fixes include: 1) Your book list is now KEPT after reinstall - yay! 2) The major problem of the page jumping around has been tackled - we'll see if it comes up again 3) It is MOSTLY finding text properly - though sometimes only on the second attempt. PROBS still include: 1) Sometimes it reads OFF the page and you have to manually find your place - esp after search. But seems mostly by just a couple of lines 2) The landscape view is not centered, but only if you START in portrait then switch...I think the app will soon be as great as the IOS version!
This is a great app. Fun to use, UI is intuitive, and support is responsive.

I like this app very much, but one major problem I don't understand has me giving it 3 stars. When listening to both PDFs & ebooks, the reader intermittently stops for no apparent reason. Usually, I like to listen while I do something else (drive, wash dishes), so having to periodically start the book playing again is pretty bothersome.

I find this app extremely helpful reading pdfs of articles and books. It has greatly improved my reading speed and comprehension. I can now read two academic articles on the bus to school/work, when previously I struggled to get two a day. Some skill is required to format scanned materials for reading. Large documents are slow and may cause crashing on low power tablets, but resolution must be high enough for effective text recognition (poor OCR is not a fault of the app). Some functions of the android version still require improvement. Highlights, bookmarks and notes do not seem to carry over with the document in other applications. When reading the document from dropbox or similar clouds, it would be nice if such changes were saved on the cloud. On iPads the sentence that is being read is highlighted, but only the highlight of the read word works for android. There are a few other small issues, but the app is nevertheless very useful.

Impossible to use. I recommend the iOS version with all my heart, this is 
too buggy. Hopping on future updates than will make this work.

It's really hard to scroll through pages, which is a huge time waster with 
this app! However, when it works, it saves a lot of time!
After recent updates my pronounciation dictionary is not working at all. Very annoying after all the time I spent g teaching it to pronounce or skip words.
Can't refund after 3 min when I realise its not working proper. Its not working on my tabletand I wasted 10 euro fore nothing
How to know that what update is included in the application when we update to the latest one
I love this app but after 2 recent updates, I am no longer able to jump the reader to specific positions by simply double tapping text.
Worst app ever. Can't get anything to open up for me. Should be offered a refund.  I've you tubed to learn and it looks completely different. Don't buy.

Doesn't play any of my epub or pdf files, that have recognized letters. Someone showed me the Apple version, and the sound quality was same as ivona reader for pc, so I thought I would have an good solution for android too now, but now it seems like wasted money.
Does not work at all compared with iOS  version.

Updated the app today and it's now practically unusable - keeps crashing! I've been using it on my Android for studying whilst commuting. Come on guys - how can the Android version be this bad when the iOS version is great? Sort it out!
iOS app is ten times better than this. It doesn't usually import drive content. Not of help in present form.
I wish it could be like iPhone one
It's an amazing app, very useful. I use it to read articles or documents. There still is some bugs with the app though.

Please add a Dropbox or Google Drive syncing feature for using the app with multiple devices to  keep your progress in sync. Also please list details of the update.  It would be helpful to see what has been updated.
Now that the highlited text as you read feature is working, I think that this is the best app for reading in the market...

I've used both the iOS and Android versions of this app and this version is seriously lacking. It won't allow me to import half of my documents from google drive and there is no explanation as to why. I used to use this a lot for proof-reading before I switched phones, but this version is barely functional.

I have struggled with dyslexia well going to college and was very grateful when a professor showed me this app. They're not very many programs that can convert text to speech as quickly as this one can. It is extremely user-friendly and I am so thankful that I am able to use it for my studies

The best app I've ever used. I'm pretty forgetful as to what chapters are in the book I'm reading and Dream Reader knows just when to remove entire paragraphs in the middle of the book and replace them with the table of contents. I also love scrolling and since the jump to chapter function does nothing I get to enjoy 5 minutes of scrolling trying to find the chapter I want to read. If you have the ten dollars to spend and enjoy hitting buttons that do nothing, as much as I do, then this app is for you.

A really cool app, especially with some fancy accessibility features for visually impaired users. Ability to listen to web pages, PDF and other documents as if they were audio files is a very nice touch and is very well implemented. For example, one can fast forward and rewind by words, sentences and lines on the fly as the file is being played. With access to multiple TTS engines you can make your listening experience as comfortable as you want. The only thing I would like to see is the implementation of word-level highlighting for Google TTS (Android Oreo now provides the necessary APIs to do so).

This is a wonderful app for both android and iOS. Though I wish I could search through all of my content not just by words as well. I have hundreds of documents saved up be it books, random articles, or emails it would be nice to just search through them by group words then me remembering where something is. If anyone knows how to do this can you please email me thanks.

After another update the play button works consistently which is great.  I don't know what other things they fixed as there is no change log.  Things that I noticed that would be nice to have fixed are the ability to use media buttons on headphones or Bluetooth to skip forward and back like you can on the app, proper spacing and layout when you download websites would get it up to ios standards. Small fixes like fully highlighting the word instead of missing the first letter and showing the full time format "00:00" when you are below one minutes would be appreciated.  Lastly it would be nice to edit names and the order manually to make it easier to play articles continuously but that would be going above the iOS version.  If you could take care of those I would be happy to rate it 5 stars and I'm sure I won't be the only on be that does. Thank you for your time and effort on this app I really love it.

Much improved almost on par with the iOS app. Hands down my most used app. It was the only app which kept me from jumping to Android. Support for pocket and instapaper is greatly appreciated although for some reason it isn't listed in the description. Also there is a bug after linking your account you should tap the little i and specify how many articles to retain (import) otherwise only the latest article is imported. The only setting that I can't seem to find is automatically jumping to the next article, once this is implemented it will definitely be a perfect 5 star app. Keep up the great work!
It is a great app however, you cannot skip forward and backwards with the books anymore. It used to work I'm not sure what happened. Hopefully you guys will be able to fix this soon.
My go-to text reader!
Would like to see an actual list of changes when there's an update..
Best in class
Wow works so well. I was facing an issue and contacted the team and it was fixed so quickly. Love the product and the support provided wow!!! Hats Off to John who fixed the issue for me.
I've been using this app for a few years now and I'm very happy with it.

Dear voice dream reader I am so thankful for the updates would you please leave notes about what got fixed with each update? Would be really helpful  Amazing app helping me in reading my books and articles, it has long way for improvements, hopefully will get fixed soon
I love the new custom pronunciation dictionary. The app has greatly improved over the year. Keep up the great job.
Great app that keeps improving

Export to the app doesn't work using the share sheet from any app I've tried. Only works from a browser.   List of apps to import from within the app is totally random e.g. Icon packs, memory booster app etc. And doesn't include important from apps like Instapaper or Pocket.  Can't set default voice speed so you have to go into the settings every time you listen to a new document to speed up the voice.   Works great on iOS, but not good on Android.
replyContent: Pocket and Instapaper integration are now in.   And there have lots of fixes to importing from other apps.  If you still see issues for sharing document from other apps, please email support with details and we will investigate it.

content: So far the best reading app. I can easily download and use excellent sounding voices from the software of Ivona. I recommend.
Keeps telling me "import failed"
replyContent: Please contact support with info about what documents are failing to import.

content: Absolutely brilliant application that helps me a lot in my studies. Thank you very much to the developers! ðŸŽ‰
Life Saver
It's just a waste of money... And the after 9 emails the problem still persists... The support is aweful
Cracking a lot !!  I've paid for use it and it's seems the worst app in whole play store.

I love the program makes it so easy to listen text books etc while doing stuff round the house and looking after the kids. Only gripe is it would be awsome if u could cast the audio. Just bought a google home and the feature would be great to cast it and listen while I rest or go to sleep.
It's been okay. Can't use purchased voices system-wide. Updates often with no update notes. Can't export audio to file.
It is excellent

For the last upgrade your program only crashed once every hour. I only had to open the program up and press play again for restart the program. Now that you fixed it with an upgrade. It crashes or goes into fast forward every five minutes, that means I cannot find a place I was reading it without searching for it. I really enjoyed this program when I had an Apple product. I found it at work very well on those devices but on my Samsung I've been waiting for a long time and you still can't get it right. I'm going to move back to Moon Reader Pro
It's great, but still missing features from iOS version
It is very beautiful app. After new update its working very well. Good job voice dream reader team

Thank you, thank you, thank you! I've replied very heavily on this app on iOS for years. Now using an Android phone for work, I'm grateful for the chance to purchase and use here too! This app is a lifesaver for me, and I only have trouble reading. I have to imagine it's an even more critical tool for folks who have visual imparemebt. I now don't buy audible books. Instead I buy on Kindle, strip the DRM, and read as epub format in Dream Reader app. Only feature request is for a brief pause after paragraph breaks, as chapter headings and quotes at beginning of chapters often sound very weird. A voice you really like is well worth the money to pay extra for, so try them until you find one you like. The Will Happy voice is my favorite. So smooth and I can listen very fast and still understand everything.  Thank you again!
Perfect, I can "read" a book while exercising.
After the last update today 18.6.17 the last glitch has been corrected and previously purchased voices can be restored. This is hands down the very best voice reader.

The app froze on the first screen, could not select a voice, could not even close the app using the mouse had to escape out of it.  Pointless for Chromebook.  Really dissapointed.   I was hoping to use this with Bookshare for my dyslexic daughter, but until this is fixed, I won't be using it.
Can't use it; keeps shutting down on Android
I agree with other comments. The IOS app is excellent; however, after all this time this app is still buggy.
This is a great app on iOS, but unfortunately not great on Android.  Very buggy on my Kindle Fire HD.  Hope to see better versions in the future.

Terrible terrible! So many glitches. I bought the app to assist in studying, but all it does is make me waste more time restarting it. It stops reading mid sentence, skips sentences when reading, and when attempting to highlight, the cursor jumps all over the place. Plain JUNK! TOTAL WASTE OF MY HARD EARNED MONEY.
"We don't bother to update our app!" is what your "update notification" should say - No updates ever - although desperately needed.
App is missing the ability to 'teach' pronunciation of words to the app. iOS version had this & it's a vital feature for listening to study texts since words are phonetically spoken.

I'm content with this app being a work in progress on Android, the iOS version is so fantastic that I'm happy to wait while it is further developed, however no change log and updates about the development is very frustrating and is the only reason I'm leaving a 2 star review.
The iOS voice dream reader has more features. The Android version is very disappointing in comparison.
Android version is horrible, stops reading mid sentence, PDFs are poorly formatted. Nowhere close to the iOS version. Avoid! I'd like a refund for this

This app is of value to me on iOS, because of the British Voice Amy, that's why I purchased it on Android in the first place. Other voices are not half as good as Amy is. And, imagine, it is not present on Android!
Fine for ipad not android! Cant even upload pdf to it. Not worth the money.

This app might work better for some people, however, there are free apps that work just the same as this one and doesn't cost $10 dollars. And since I can't get a refund on this, I've tried to like this app, however I just can't. It was recommended to my by someone, however, I thought it would work a little different than something else I've used and it doesn't. It works the same except what I used before was free. The IOS version of this app might be nicer,  however this version of it just isn't what I wanted. Not to mention trying to get it to read the things that I want it to read has been painful at best. I mean really, it feels like the built in functionality on my device and other apps is equal to this. Most of those, I can't say I recommend. You would expect if your spending money for this that it would have better functionality.
My school uses this with Bookshare service for struggling readers. Work great together.

userName: TJ BREEN A son of Jehovah by FAITH in Jesus Christ
content: Compared to iOS counter part DISGUSTING Without comparison for the money it SUCKS
dont work dont play
Awesome app for students with disabilities.
Terrible app (unlike it's fantastic iOS counterpart.) Importing pdf's is the only thing that has worked for me so far. Everything else has been frustrating and a waste of time

I was using this app on my iPhone and now switched to Android. What a huge difference in quality. The one on Apple had bug fixed all the time. This one is like an abondonned app is this a joke? It stopped letting me highlight text any more. Really appsetting. Fix. ASAP

Spent $10 on an app that sucks.  It continues to stopping working, and every time I click on a file to read that I have loaded, it add the same file to my reading list again.  I have a fee app that workes way better.  Don't waist you money.  Get a free app.
Loving this app :) .. changing words per min is behaving little weird but pause n play usually resets the behavior, so not a big of an annoyance

I have many books, historical journals and PDFs downloaded into VoiceDream and listen to them several times every day...while driving...while getting ready in the morning and while cooking dinner.... Its a great way to multi task..... I can't imagine life without it! Thank you VoiceDream creators!

They finally upgraded the speed to read text quickly! The app crashes when you change speeds or exit the document sometimes but I'm hoping they will fix it. Still... The most expensive and greatest value I've gotten from an app.

Reads text (I use PDFs) great and with the "Sharon" voice it's almost like an audiobook reader.    There is no better tool on Android.    My ONLY complaint is it's not as feature rich as the IOS version. I can understand as it's recently added but as someone that recently switched from IOS to android I really miss those features. Specially the ability to text replace (such as read AL as "alignment").  5 stars once it has the IOS features.
replyContent: We're working hard to bring the Android version to the same feature set as the iOS version,

content: Does not show summaries like other apps I have tried
Very nice and useful

Great app, so buggy, after 1hr of listening and highlighting, the app froze and lost my highlights. The same thing happened again and again, with the price tag I expected it to function, or at least the functions within the app working. Sounds like a half done conversion from ios to android. Reports sent, hopefully this can be rectified
This app enables me to read a book a day. A little buggy on Android but still good.
Android version does not support user dictionary of pronunciations. Does not support loading articles saved in Pocket. Neither point mentioned in Google Play description.
Love love love
I use iton IOS and works great Not here. | would like a refund

They're a small team working on both iOS and Android, but they're responsive. This is a great app for students struggling with reading, and I recommend it frequently to schools and districts. Keep it up! You should see the look on these kid's faces when they realize they can access text and compete with their peers.

This is absolutely great app for listening to ebooks. I have tried several app from play store. But this is the best. The features are very good.
Really needs the prenunciation dictionary feature like the ios Version that said it is unsurpassed on android and can only compete with itself

I use this on my iPad at home and I use a Samsung tablet at work. It's barely usable on the Android platform plus the Pocket integration is missing.  I can't accept this much difference between platforms. Stability, speed,  etc. I deleted it from my work tablet and I'll actively search for a suitable, multi platform replacement for all my devices.
Don't brother to purchase this app. The developer simply don't value their android customer. The save from Web page function still not working.

I have the ios version and it's fantastic,  but the Android version is full of bugs and has very limited functionality.  For instance,  you have way more voice options to download on the ios version.  Please bring this app up to par with the ios version asap.
Great tts....  used on iPhone glad to see it for Android....
It's the best app Tts I ever have
iOS App is awesome, Android version not so much

Sure a big part of the price goes to the company which supplies the high quality TTS. Sure this app has the monopoly of book reading software in Android. BUT, the instability of this app just makes me really wonder if this company really is capable of making an Android app. Sorry for my critique, I don't wanna be mean or anything, but your app is pricey so I think I'm entitled to have some words. I hope the app can be better.
Dont pay for it. There are some fre apps that are much better!
This app almost made me leave Android cause I loved it on Apple. Worth every penny.

I am a user of the TalkBack screen reader on Android and do a lot of reading. I have been using this app for a while now, and it is by far the best experience on Android. I also enjoy the iPhone version is well. Thank you so much for developing this app and for continuing to update it. I truly appreciate your efforts. Keep up the good work. I highly recommend this application to anyone.

I downloaded this on the advice of my husband who uses the iOS version every night to listen to before sleep.  This seems to be lacking the important sleep timer though and some of the available voices?  They are in love with Amy. HA!. Would love to know what the status is and once emplimented will update review. Thanks!
It doesn't show up on my apps list.

I'm sad to see the Android version of Voice Dream, I was having the one for iPhone and I have to say it was my absolute favorite app of all, with great service, settings and options and so I was even willing to accept, but not happy about it, to pay almost the double of what I paid for the one of iPhone ...only to find myself with a much less developed Beta version of it. What happened, guys?! Please update this app to its real capacity, I was really a fan of it, don't make me regret my purchase.
replyContent: We know the Android version misses some features in the iOS version. The reasons are complicated but I would happy tell you over email. But your 1-star review drives potential buyers away, which makes it even harder to justify pouring resources into this app. Please help us by removing your review. Thank you.

content: This is my first time ever to review an app, but this is such a rip of, I had to. My friend has this app on iPhone and she thought it is great. She suggested that I would get it as I am dyslexia and it would really benefit me with college. From the day I downloaded this app, it never worked right but now it won't even let me into the pdf files that I have already downloaded onto this app. I am waiting for months for this app to improve and it still hasn't. I am very disappointed with this app for â‚¬11

Could not open anything to read in this application on my smartphone, I contacted customer service 3 times and they either did not respond or they were very unhelpful. I managed to open a pdf, after having to download yet another app for it to work, but that stopped working (app says unable to read).
Saving time and money don't trade your time for money get what  need from readable content n move on to the next best thing quickly!!
We need this! If you make it as good as the IOS, I'm sure you will do well with it and we who need it will begin  so deeply greateful! Thank you for creating this app!
Highly unstable...

Loved the app!! It's transformed my reading enjoyment, improved my reading (even had carryover into my reading when not using the app), massively improved my reading speed and coming out on Android has been a really blessing. Although android need to fix a few bugs (crashes when changing the reading speed).
Great App! I was apprehensive about it because of the price, but it exceeded my expectations. If you could use something like this it is worth the buy.

It helped with my e-text in college most just need update to get what iPad version had but will come in time I know busy working on it will wait but helped a lot will help me in college and going forward
Worked great on IOS, doesn't begin to work on Android

Please use images and descriptions and info on books that are now available in Bookshare books after a week I had so many bugs I had to stop using it.  The program has so much promise that I don't mind paying for it in hopes that they will improve and update it.
I really enjoy the features this software provides. its easy to use and navigate my library of books. and the superior option for bookshare users. well worth a purchase and support.

The iOS version of this app is an absolute gem. I didn't think twice about buying this again for Android to encourage and support the developers to stick with us. Android DESPERATELY needs a quality text-to-speech reading app. I have complete faith that this is the app to do it!
The app has a very good voices and the usability is very good, but have a lot of bugs! Now it stops works. I cannot press the play button.
Not great, not bad.  It doesn't understand abbreviation and it cannot ignore foot notes.  The foot notes are the name of the chapter and the page numbers and it's very annoying
Best app to read PDF & Vookshare books. Compatible with TalkBack. Please keep developing for Android.

I know the app is not at the iOS level but I trust them they will manage to reach it! I waited this app to switch to android (it's not a joke since I use it like 2 hours each day commuting) I am sorry they don't offer "Paul" English voice from Acapella (which I found the best on iOS) but try Sharon or Will. Sharon sounds better for me. ... Few months passed from the original review. I gave the app 5 stars hopping go see it one day at the same level like the one in ios. Nothing changed. 4 stars...

I have this on my iPad and I love it so I thought I would buy it for my phone. I really regretting that. For an app that costs as much as it does it doesn't even begin to work right. It doesn't read at all for me. I hit play and it just rapidly scrolls through the doc. Very disappointed

Give me my money back! This app is not reliable and it crashes way too much and doesn't read your pdf files properly and skips and glitches out on you. I paid 13$ for this crap and it's not even worth 99 cents.
I love this app on iOS and while the android version isn't as good, it's still better then other android tts software.
Not stable
On android phone, the app crashes frequently, needs more work.

I was looking for something that allowed my already purchased books from Google to be read with amazing voices. Although this had great voice selection it could not read any of my books. If it did this I would have gladly kept it.

Going to give this app 4 stars because in most respects this is a great piece of software and truly helps me power through books quickly and with high comprehension and retention. And I know good reviews will help others discover Voice Dream. In general, it is worth the investment.  But I will warn users on Android that at this point Voice Dream isn't as stable as it is on iOS. In fact, it has crashed a number of times, losing extensive notes and highlights within books (both times PDFs). This is in my opinion the best reading app available on Android, but this crashing (with complete loss of notes and highlights in the books that initiated the crash!) is really frustrating. Be careful, folks, until they get this worked out. You may stand to lose hours and hours of work. Until they address it I'll have to stick with the iOS version. (I'm fortunate in having access through work to both platforms. I'm sure most don't have that luxury.)
It would be better if you had it open in share or "open with"  section. It often freezes when opening URL. I like the dyslexia font.
A waste of my time and money I can't even use the app with bookshelf.

I have to read a lot of PDFs and this app is saving my eyes and my brain!  My only problem is that it won't read the last paragraph of the PDFs or sometimes the last page.  Not a huge problem because I am capable of reading it myself,  but it would be nice to be able to have it read the whole text.
I bought this app for my son to be able to read his book with bookshare but the app is always crashing. Truly a waste of my money.
replyContent: Can you please email us at support@voicedream.com so we can figure out why you're getting so many crashes? Thanks.

content: I tell everybody about the iOS apps - both the voice dream reader and voice dream writer. After getting an Android phone this really was the first thing I downloaded. I would suggest Winston the developer could stop asking people to remove the negative reviews here and spend that time improving this app. I have tested EVERY text to speech app in android and I am sure a Voice Dream Reader Android app that worked like his iOS would be a best seller. Come on man! Stop whining and rise to the challenge!!! X :-)
Please keep it up and make this app better,  we need it,  needs improvements but it's heading in the right direction
It is not in the same level as the iphone app.
replyContent: We know that this, of course. When ratings drive potential customers away, it really makes it hard for us to rationally continue making investment in this product. Plus, the app should be rated on its own merits rather than in comparison with the product on a totally different platform.

content: Worth every buck.   PROS - checked off a lot of books -  no more eye strain -  clear voices   - satisfied for clearing years long list of book collection.  CONS - none ..... I don't understand why its so under rated ?

This is by far the best TTS app on Android! There are a few occasional bugs, but this app is new to Android and the bugs are easily worked through (most times by exiting and reopening the book).  Developer: don't give up, you do such great work!! I tell all my friends about your app. (For extra revenue, you might consider the paid service that mananto reader is doing. I would gladly pay a recurring premium to have my books/notes/highlights synced between all my devices and manageable online via PC).

Ok, so I love the Apple voice dream app where I can change pronunciation, access pocket and more voices. Please add functionality for Android and then this will be 5*. I really do love this app and would like to enjoy it as much on my phone. With that said, it's still the best android voice reader.

I started using Voice Dream as soon as it became available for android. I use it every day and I absolutely love it!! There are more options available with the IOS version, but it is still a work in progress for android so give it some time, I think it will be even better in the future.... but honestly, even if it stayed the same I wouldn't mind. Money very well spent! The developer is working very hard to make android comparable to IOS. Be patient! Thank you for the great App!! â˜º
Works wonderfully well.  Thanks devs.

I Want A Refund. I paid Ten Bucks, Only to wind up having to download a different reader because this one could not open any file I selected. Doesn't appear in share choices from web & doesn't even show how to go to reader from whatever page or text you want read. I haven't been read a single thing from this app, & all for Ten bucks. A whole Ten worth of Nothing. Please refund my money. I give this app MINUS STARS!
replyContent: What kind of files are you trying to open? The app supports file formats listed in the description of the app. I hope you were able to get your money back from Google, but please do not blame me if you bought the app without knowing what it can do.

content: It's the best study tool possible for a med student. Still hasn't reached the level of the ios version but still beats all the other similar apps.
I get issues when I try to select new places too start seems like a delay if some sort and it crashes.

Finally, Android has an app that highlighted words as they are being read! My dyslexic students bless you! Excellent, fair price too, with the included voice. App perfection! Kudos to the developer! One needed addition would be to include the app in the Share menu to facilitate Web article reading. Please add this feature.
Please add support for kindle. The app is superb.
replyContent: The description of the app states that no app can read Kindle books. The books are encrypted with DRM.

content: I waited to switch to Android until this app was available on it. Seriously. I understand it is still fresh and look forward to the updates since I know it's potential from the IOS version. Salli is the best voice. She has the only voice I've found on any app that sounds natural enough to get lost in the story and not get distracted by the robotic elements of the TTS voice. Once the Ivona voices are available and I can use Salli to read me bedtime stories, I can sleep like a baby and wake up with a smile :)

Voicedream reader for android is a great addition to the google play store. Not only does it allow visually impaired users to use the ETI eloquence engine which they are accustomed to, but it also has easy, intuitive menus; supports different formats; and allows for bookshare and dropbox file imports. What's more, it also plays while the screen is locked, on first try; unlike other reading applications which I have had to struggle with in the past. Admitedly, there are a few bugs that still need to be worked out: application crashes when navigating too quickly when hitting the next button, navigation issues in certain books when using the bookmark section of the app to get to chapters. Over all though, voicedream Reader is amazing; and judging by the quality of the IOS version of this app; I don't doubt that developers will continue to improve upon this one. IN fact, I'm sure that by next year, the android version of VoiceDream reader will be equal to the IOS version. This is well worth the ten dollars, trust me!

For a $10. App I would think it would allow me to change the sound of the voice reading. Some material is harder to follow with certain voices. I tried changing the voice and wasn't able to. When I selected a new voice which cost another 4 bucks, it would just skip around and not allow the selection.

Although it crashes frequently, it is still a better TTS experience than any other app. It also has great note taking features which are very useful for students. I find that it is more stable when reading plain text files than rich text or pdf. Be sure to export your notes regularly in case it crashes and refuses to open the file again. I have had to reinstall the program once to recover from issues and have had to give up on certain files, but when this app works, it is like magic.

100% unusable.  I want a refund!  Have yet to get it to open. Consistently crashing and I have to reinstall each time.  I need something that works.  I'm in school and don't have time for unfinished, overpriced apps.
replyContent: We're sorry about your experience. This is a new, 1.0 app developed by a single developer for people with reading disabilities. I just don't have a army of people to test for the thousands of Android devices and configurations. I wish customers who run into problem would contact us and it's generally an easy fix. It will benefit the world.

content: It's not done yet; it's basically a beta.  *But*.  This app understands TTS better than any other app I've used.  If you rely on TTS for your ebooks, this app is 100% worth it, despite frequent crashes and missing features and so on.  I'll update this review when it's less half-baked, but even now it's worth 5 stars for me for the TTS focused nature of the app.
Although the android version is still being developed, I have the original one for Ipad and I love it. I understand it's potential.

This is a great application for reading PDFs epubs and Daisy books as well as other types of formats. I have gotten in contact with the developer to developer is working hard to improve all kinds of features that users request for the application. Looking forward to seeing new features are being developed for the application and future updates.
great for momemt...want money back...should be free or not avaible until works...
replyContent: Hi Neva, I'm sorry for the problems you are having. Could you email us at support@voicedream.com to share the specifics of what problems you are having please? We would really appreciate the feedback and are working hard to make the app a better experience for all.

content: it is absolutely an amazing app. When taking into consideration that those are initial releases, we could expect a very bright future for this tool. great set of features and easiness of use. we still waiting .doc and .docx support and more polished and stable way of managing voices.
I used the Iphone version which is amazing. The developers must address the issues here. App has great potential but in one word it's JAMMED. Looking forward for an update.
replyContent: Hi Orem, I'm sorry for the problems. Could you email your specific issues to support@voicedream.com so we can help resolve them? Thanks!

content: This has the potential to be a greatly product. Voice qualuty is excellent. HOWEVER many of the features advertised appear to be missing from the Androud implementation and integration with the Android TTS environment would help a lot.  Should be worth the money when its finished. For now even e stars is being kind
replyContent: Hi Roy, this is a 1.0 product and we are working hard to extend its functionality to that of the iOS version. We will be adding the additional functionality over the coming few months, I hope you can keep working with the app as it is enhanced!

content: I've use this app on my iPad works fine,  I'm happy but there is room for improvement. Android however so far I am very disappointed. First of all manage voice crashes the app. There is no way to stop the program from reading the same headers and footers on every page for example I read lost of manuals with the same header and footer on 30 pages where the only difference is a page number. The pronunciation of some words isn't perfect  but there is no way to edit it. The user guide  is a joke. The search doesn't work for me,  to find a page or chapter I've had to  scroll through many pages manually. My final thought, it could be a very app  at this moment there is a hole lot of room for improvement especially at that price.
replyContent: Hi Joseph, I am sorry for the problems you are having and we are working very hard to resolve the initial issues in this 1.0 app. The manage voices crash should be fixed in the next release. The reading of headers and footers for PDF is not something we can control at present and I believe the iOS version does the same. Hope this helps!

content: Got a message it is a corrupted file & would not open. Got a refund...thank you. Work out the bugs & I'll be sure to check it out again.
replyContent: Hi Bobbie, I am sorry about the corrupted file bug. We will be publishing an update to fix that problem today and you should be able to update later today to resolve this problem.

content: It sounded great But everytime I tried to change the voice,  the program would Crash and yoi could not start it again without restarting mu Samsung Galaxy Note 4. So I  had to get a refund.
replyContent: So sorry about the issue you ran into. Can you please email us at support@voicedream.com so we can get some more information about the crash? We will find a fix.

content: Very hard to get started with no instruction On how to get the books into your library. I will try a bit more before finding something I can work.
replyContent:
The publishing industry uses DRM for most eBooks (Amazon Kindle, Google Play Books, iBooks, etc.), which encrypts them so they can't be read by a 3rd party app. This is stated clearly in the description of this app. 
People use this app to listen to PDF files and DRM-free eBooks from Bookshare, Gutenberg, and books with DRM removed.

content: Get your reading done faster, anywhere.
Needs improvement, but it's the most useful app I ever bought, well designed, great work guys!!!!
This app is wonderful. It's intuitive and very accessible. Excellent!
